SEARCH
Module graphicInterface
Package graph

Class Edge

java.lang.Object
graph.Edge
public class Edge extends Object
Edge is used for the adjacency list. It represents a link between two Positions. This class also has a weight. This will be useful to represent barriers.

    • Edge

      public Edge(Position source, Position target, int weight) throws BadWeightException
      Constructor method for the Edge class. It takes 2 Position parameters and a weight.
      Parameters:
      source - source of the edge
      target - target of the edge
      weight - weight of the edge
      Throws:
      BadWeightException - if the value is negative, throws an exception.

    • normalizeEdgePositions

      public int normalizeEdgePositions(Position[] positions, Board board)
      Takes an edge and a list of Position to write in, and write the Positions so that the smallest in terms of adjacency list index is the first element, and the biggest the second
      Parameters:
      positions - list in which we write
      board - game board
      Returns:
      the adjacency list index of the smallest among the two positions

    • setBidirectionalEdgeWeight

      public void setBidirectionalEdgeWeight(int weight, Board board) throws BadWeightException
      Sets the weight of an edge and of its opposite
      Parameters:
      weight - weight to set to the edge
      board - game board
      Throws:
      BadWeightException - if the value is negative, throws an exception.
